page.title: 01A general view,N.Wingfield
page.content: {North Wingfield}parish (ie. part of this block) is mentioned in the original Domesday survey-1086.It is a largely rural block with the main centres of population to the north- N.Wingfield & edge of Holmewood. Block contains(A)reclaimed land from disused coal mines(B)small industrial estates (C)small farms-mixed arable land(D)a disused railway-now a nature trail (E)main railway line.Other areas of population in small villages-Danesmoor Lower Pilsley, Waterloo, Astwith, Parkhouse Green and Hepthorne Lane. Housing is mixed council and private- a number of old brick terraces; newer brick modern homes and a small proportion of old stone houses, especially in rural parts. N.Wingfield church is of Norman origin but is mainly perpendicular gothic. {General Editors:F.M.Brown&J.E.Durbin
